page.title: 09AN ALSAGER SMALLHOLDING
page.content: On the small holding there is a sow and five piglets, 102 ducks, 2 cockerels, 12 hens, (some of which were hatched at school) 1 cat and 3 dogs. He also grows crops: potatoes, peas, turnips, cabbages, sprouts, leeks and hay. He gets up at half past 6 in the morning in the winter and later in the summer. He sells and gives crops and animals to relations and friends. He has got a tractor and nearly all the machinery for it. The small holding is only a hobby, his real job is as an engineer at the Royal Ordnance Factory at Radway Green. He makes 27 millimetre aircraft cannon shells. When he was little he had relations who had a farm and when he was 14 years old he decided that he would have a small holding. By Dawn Cresswell and Lucy Perkins.
